attributes.title: Fat Tire
attributes.description:
Created on November 22, 2010 by KellyB on Sourcemap.org:

This beer has a balance of toasty, biscuit-like malt flavors coasting in equilibrium with hoppy freshness.

attributes.name: Fat Tire
attributes.title: Fat Tire
attributes.description: This beer has a balance of toasty, biscuit-like malt flavors coasting in equilibrium with hoppy freshness.

attributes.name: Barley
attributes.title: Barley
attributes.description: The barley for the beer made at the New Belgium Brewery comes from local growers in Colorado.

attributes.name: Water
attributes.title: Water
attributes.description: The New Belgium Brewery has its own water treatment facility which provides water for all the brews, including Fat Tire.

attributes.name: Malted Barley
attributes.title: Malted Barley
attributes.description: Some malted barley is imported from Canada, which is shipped to Fort Collins, Colorado.

attributes.name: Malted Barley
attributes.title: Malted Barley
attributes.description: More malted barley is imported from across the United States, which is one of the ingredients in beer.

attributes.name: Hops
attributes.title: Hops
attributes.description: Hops from the Northwestern United States are shipped to the New Belgium Brewery in order to make brews such as Fat Tire.

attributes.name: Glass
attributes.title: Glass
attributes.description: The glass used to make the bottles at the New Belgium Brewery is trucked to Fort Collins from WIndsor, Colorado.

attributes.name: Cardboard
attributes.title: Cardboard
attributes.description: The cardboard used make boxes for the beer is made locally in Colorado before being shipped to numerous states.
